page.title: 04THE GORSEDD_PERRANPORTH
page.content: The Gorsedd is a Celtic festival held this summer at Perranporth. The festival celebrates all things Cornish. It encourages traditions of Cornwall, art, poetry, stories,dance, music, the history of Cornwall and interest in the Cornish language. It has links with Wales and Brittany. The festival was started in 1928. It is a meeting of the bards. To be a bard you must do something special for Cornwall and speak Cornish. The bards wear a long blue robe and a special headdress. This year 1985 the ceremony will be held at St.Piran's Round, a Celtic ampitheatre.The ceremony includes a Flower Dance in a circle performed by 12 girls aged 9 or 10 years.The music is played on a harp.The girls wear a white dress decorated with flowers and a headdress of wild flowers.
